journal-title-group.journal-title: Proceedings. Annual Conference on Taxation and Minutes of the Annual Meeting of the National Tax Association

subj-group.subject: Effects of Tax Policy on Income Inequality and Volatility

title-group.subtitle: The Contribution of Income Dispersion and Taxation

abstract.p: This paper examines the contributions of tax policy, the income distribution, and behavioral responses to the link between income and consumption inequality. We use income from the Panel Study of Income Dynamics in conjunction with consumption from the Consumer Expenditure Survey as complementary indicators of inequality. We document the increase in income dispersion in the 1980s and 1990s are due to increases in both permanent and transitory income shocks. Further, wend an increase in the link between income and consumption inequality due to changes in tax policy, partially mitigated by changes in the income distribution and household behavioral responses.
